contextId.information: This generalization refers to a great number of people, not to every single person. AT: "Many people from Judea and Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: The whole country of Judea and all the people of Jerusalem

contextId.information: Here the word "all" is a hyperbole and is used to emphasize that a great number of people came. AT: "many who were sick or possessed by demons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: all who were sick or possessed by demons

contextId.information: The word "Everyone" is a hyperbole used to emphasize that many people were looking for Jesus. AT: "Many people are looking for you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

The word "throughout" is an exaggeration used to emphasize that Jesus went to many locations during his ministry. AT: "He went to many places in Galilee" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: He went throughout all of Galilee

contextId.information: The word "everywhere" is a hyperbole used to emphasize that the people came from many places. AT: "from all over the region" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
Here "everything" is a hyperbole or exaggeration. He explained all his parables. AT: "he explained all his parables" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
Possible meanings are 1) "they may lose consciousness temporarily" or 2) "they may become weak." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

Jesus uses a hyperbole to emphasize that there is nothing in the world you can gain worth losing your life over. AT: "if he gains everything in the world" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
Jesus uses a hyperbole to emphasize that it is very difficult for rich people to get into the kingdom of God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: It is easier ... kingdom of God

contextId.information: Jesus feels so much distress and sorrow that he feels like he is about to die. AT: "and I feel like I could die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: even to the point of death
